Welcome to Notebook API’s documentation!¶

Notebook API main¶

async main.ban_ips(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The ban_ips function is a middleware function that checks if the client’s IP address is in the banned_ips list. If it is, then we return a JSON response with status code 403 and an error message. Otherwise, we call the next middleware function and return its response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the chain

Returns:

A json response object if the client’s ip address is in the banned_ips list

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly. It does this by executing a SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then there’s something wrong with the database configuration.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

Notebook API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserCreate, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserCreate: Pass the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: EmailStr, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email address and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email address. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email is found in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – models.User: Specify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Pass in the token that is returned from the spotify api

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • contact – ContactCreate: Pass in the contact data that is being created

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – models.User: Get the user’s id to filter the contacts

  • contact_id – int: Filter the contacts by id

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(db: Session, user: User, email: EmailStr)¶

The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact by email.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – models.User: Ensure that the user is authenticated

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

Returns:

The first contact in the database that matches the email address and user id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, email: str | None, user: User, first_name: str | None, last_name: str | None, skip: int, limit: int)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts that match the search criteria.
Args:

db (Session): The database session object. email (str | None): The email address to search for in the database. If no value is provided, all contacts are returned. user (models.User): The user who owns the contact(s). This is used to ensure that only a single users’ contacts are returned and not all users’ contacts in the database table/collection/etc.. first_name (str | None): A string containing part or all of a first name to be searched

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • email – str | None: Filter the contacts by email

  • user – models.User: Get the user id of the current logged-in user

  • first_name – str | None: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str | None: Filter the contacts by last name

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

:param : Pass in the database session to use for querying :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.read_contacts_by_week_to_birthday(db: Session, user: User, skip: int, limit: int)¶

The read_contacts_by_week_to_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – models.User: Filter the contacts by user_id

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the list

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts that are returned

:param : Get the contacts from a specific user :return: A list of contacts whose birthdays are in the next week :doc-author: Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(db_contact, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

db_contact (Contact): The contact to be removed from the database. db (Session): A session object for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • db_contact – Pass in the contact we want to delete

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A none, but the delete function returns a number of rows deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db_contact, contact: ContactCreate, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

db_contact (models.Contact): The contact to be updated in the database. contact (ContactCreate): The new information for the existing Contact object, which will overwrite its old data.

Parameters:

  • db_contact – Pass the contact to be updated

  • contact – ContactCreate: Pass the contact object to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

Notebook API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database. If not, an error message will be returned. If there is a user with that email, then we check if they have already confirmed their account or not (if they have already confirmed their account). If they haven’t yet confirmed their account, then we update our database so that this particular users’ &quot;confirmed&quot; field becomes True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

An access token and a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token and refresh_token pair.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email from the token :return: A dict with the token type, access_token and refresh_token :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send a confirmation email to the user.

The function takes in an email address and sends a confirmation link to that address. If the user already has confirmed their account, they will be notified of this.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email and username from the database :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserCreate, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserCreate: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get a database session

:param : Get the user’s email from the database :return: A dictionary with the user object and a detail message :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to read a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer ID, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), email: str | None = None, first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function is used to retrieve a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • email – Annotated[str | None: Filter the contacts by email

  • first_name – Annotated[str | None: Pass the first_name parameter to the function

  • last_name – Annotated[str | None: Filter the contacts by last name

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts_by_week_to_birthday(skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The read_contacts_by_week_to_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the current user :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Get the contact id from the path :return: A boolean value :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact: ContactCreate, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a ContactCreate object as input, then returns the updated contact.

Parameters:

  • contact – ContactCreate: Create a new contact

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: An updated contact :doc-author: Trelent

Notebook API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1b4ece54de545446980ae3432c9fea1fba79ed03cafca80e0da09f98fb2cd39e'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional timedelta of seconds for the token’s expiration time.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() which represents when the token was created, and exp (expiration time) claim is set to one day from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded into the token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A jwt that contains the user’s id, username, and email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired. If it’s valid, it returns the email address of the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that we want to decode

Returns:

The email of the user who owns the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Pass the token from the authorization header to this function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the JWT using PyJWT’s decode method, which returns a dictionary of payload data. If the scope is &quot;email_token&quot;, then we know this is an email verification token, so we return its subject (the user’s email). Otherwise, if it isn’t an email verification token or if there was some other error decoding it (like expired), then we raise HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A password hash

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Verify the password that is stored in the database

Returns:

True or false depending on if the password is correct

Doc-author:

Trelent

The send_email function sends an email to the user’s email address.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. host (str): The host of the website, used for creating a link in the message body.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • host – str: Pass the host name of the server to be used in the email

Returns:

A coroutine object, which is a special
